description:
Tsukasa Akeuraji, a frustrated skater, meets a girl called Inori Yuitsuka, who is yearning to enter the world of figure skating. Motivated by Inori's obsession on the rink, Tsukasa takes on coaching Inori himself. Inori's talent blossoms, and Tsukasa becomes a brilliant mentor. Together they aim to make her a glorious medalist!!

(Source: Disney+)

tags.name: Ice Skating
tags.description: Centers around the sport of ice skating.

tags.name: Athletics
tags.description: Centers around sporting events that involve competitive running, jumping, throwing, or walking.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)
__Aiko Yamagami__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter.
__Tomoki Nagasaka__ is a Japanese editor who works for post production studio Jay Film.

**[Website](https://www.cristinavee.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/CristinaVee) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@cristinavox) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/cristinavox) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@CristinaVeeMusic/)**

American voice actor and director with over 500 voice-over credits in animation and video games.

__Non-anime English voice roles:__
~!
- Ladybug/Marinette - *Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir (TV; 2015-)*
- Verosika Mayday - *Helluva Boss (TV; 2021)*
- Robyn Hill - *RWBY (TV; 2019-2021)*
- Nitara - *Mortal Kombat 1 (VG; 2023)*
- Tulin - *The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom (VG; 2023)*
- Mahima - *Octopath Traveller II (VG; 2023)*
- Bennet, Xingqiu - *Genshin Impact (VG; 2020)*
- Ophilia - *Octopath Traveler (VG; 2018)*!~

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/pauloporto_oficial) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PauloPo35505307)

Paulo Roberto Ribeiro Porto, better known simply as Paulo Porto, is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, and dubbing director. He is the father of voice actor [Bruno Porto](https://anilist.co/staff/270413/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Cameron Scott "Cam" Tucker (2nd voice 8th-11th season; Modern Family)
- Quackerjack (Darkwing Duck and DuckTales 2017)
- David Koechner (Most of the productions)
- Sergeant Linus Mosk (Andor)
- Dennis Nedry (1st dub; Jurassic Park)
- Frankie da Flea (1st dub; Tom and Jerry: The Movie)
- Cikatro Vizago (Star Wars Rebels)
- Mr. Bumpy (Mr. Bumpy)
- Joseph "Joey" Alvin Gladstone (Fuller House)
- Mac (1st dub; Clifford the Big Red Dog)
- Vision (Next Avengers: Heroes of Tomorrow)
- Mole (The Nut Job 1 and 2)
!~
